thread.title: Local sports briefs for Oct. 14: Chiefs' Poe, Mauga sidelined with injuries
thread.title_full: Local sports briefs for Oct. 14: Chiefs' Poe, Mauga sidelined with injuries

author: Staff
title: Local sports briefs for Oct. 14: Chiefs' Poe, Mauga sidelined with injuries
text:
Read more KU stories at HawkZone 
The Kansas City Chiefs were without two defensive players Wednesday afternoon in preparation for Week 6’s game against the Minnesota Vikings. 
Starting inside linebacker Josh Mauga (groin, Achilles) was on the field in a baseball cap observing teammates during the portion open to the media, but was not in pads and is officially listed as not practicing. 
Defensive tackle Dontari Poe also did not practice, but his absence on the field wasn’t a surprise when considering coach Andy Reid revealed Poe suffered a high-ankle sprain. 
K-STATE ADDS MATCHUPS WITH STANFORD TO 2016, ’17 FOOTBALL SCHEDULES: The Kansas State football team will face Stanford in a nationally-televised matchup on Sept. 2 to open the 2016 season, athletic director John Currie announced Wednesday. 
The home-and-home agreement will pit the Wildcats and the Cardinal against each other for the first time in history. 
The announcement finalizes the K-State non-conference schedule, which includes games against Florida Atlantic and Missouri State. 
KU VOLLEYBALL EXTENDS WINNING STREAK WITH WIN OVER BAYLOR: The No. 9-ranked Kansas volleyball team extended its winning streak to 18 straight victories with a 25-21, 13-25, 25-20, 25-17 win over Baylor on Wednesday at Waco, Texas. 
KU sophomores Kelsie Payne and Madison Rigdon recorded a team-high 13 kills apiece, and senior Tiana Dockery fell just shy of double-digit kills with nine to lead the Jayhawks (18-0, 6-0 Big 12).
